plan:
Great! Here is a simple and effective 5-day study plan for learning basic statistics. Keep in mind that consistent practice and reviewing concepts will help you master the topic.

| Day  | Focus Area                         | Activities                                           |
|-------|----------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------|
| Day 1 | Introduction to Statistics        | Learn what statistics is, types of data, and basic terms (mean, median, mode). |
| Day 2 | Data Collection and Organization  | Understand data collection methods, organizing data in tables and charts.      |
| Day 3 | Measures of Central Tendency      | Practice calculating mean, median, and mode with simple examples.               |
| Day 4 | Measures of Dispersion            | Learn about range, variance, and standard deviation with basic exercises.       |
| Day 5 | Simple Data Interpretation        | Interpret data from graphs and charts, and review all concepts learned.         |

Suggested Free Resources:
1. Khan Academy Statistics and Probability (text and videos) – Clear explanations and practice exercises.
2. OpenIntro Statistics PDF (free textbook) – Comprehensive and easy-to-understand.
3. Stat Trek website – Simple tutorials and calculators for statistics basics.

Keep going—you’re building a strong foundation in statistics! Let me know if you want me to customize this plan further.
